marketNews.title: Escalation of Trade War Trump Presses Global Markets
marketNews.content:
US President Donald Trump on Saturday (1/2) announced that he will start imposing import tariffs of 25% on Canada and Mexico and an additional tariff of 10% on top of existing tariffs for China starting Tuesday (4/2). Trump emphasized that the tariffs will not be lifted until drug trafficking from the three countries to the US stops.

Specifically, Trump set an import tariff on oil products from Mexico at 25% and from Canada at 10%. The import tariff on energy products from Canada was set lower after considering concerns from US refineries and Midwestern states. Trump also indicated that there will be additional oil and gas tariffs in mid-February 2025, without further details. Previously, Trump on Thursday (30/1) said that his side had not decided whether the announced tariffs would cover oil and gas commodities.

On the other hand, the imposition of tariffs on China came about a week after Trump mentioned that he could reach a fair trade agreement with China, although he had previously considered a 10% import tariff.

In response, Mexico and Canada – the United States' two largest trading partners – promised to announce retaliatory tariffs soon. Canada responded with a 25% tariff on US imports worth a total of $155 billion. Meanwhile, China plans to challenge the policy at the World Trade Organization (WTO) and take other retaliatory actions.

Following this news, the US Dollar Index (DXY) strengthened by 1.1% to 109.6 in today’s (Monday 3/2) trading, while the Indonesian rupiah weakened by 0.83% to 16,435 per US dollar. The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed down 1.11% at 7,030, and the yield on Indonesia’s 10-year government bonds rose 7 basis points to 7.06%.

Oil prices rose, with WTI futures increasing 3.65% to $75.2 per barrel today. The increase was caused by concerns over disrupted crude oil supplies from the two largest supplying countries to the US, while weak demand limited further gains. Gold in the spot market had briefly reached an all-time high of $2,817 per troy ounce on Friday (31/1) driven by safe-haven demand amid global growth concerns and inflation pressure, although it fell 0.09% to $2,796 per troy ounce today.

marketNews.title: BBRI Plans Share Buyback up to Rp3 Trillion
marketNews.content:
Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) plans to conduct a share buyback with a funding allocation of up to 3 trillion rupiah. The buyback is expected to take place from 12 March 2025 to 11 March 2026, with the company seeking shareholder approval at the extraordinary general meeting on 11 March 2025. The corporate action will be executed at a price deemed fair by the company in accordance with POJK No. 29/2023. The treasury shares acquired will be used for employee and/or director share ownership programs and the board of commissioners.

S&P Global reported that Indonesia’s Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.9 in January 2025 (vs. 51.2 in December 2024), indicating two consecutive months of factory activity growth and the strongest pace since May 2024. The result was supported by output increases for three straight months and the strongest rise since May 2024. New orders continued to grow amid rising foreign orders for two consecutive months. Companies also increased purchasing ahead of Ramadan, with employment reaching its highest level in 2.5 years. Sentiment remained positive, backed by expectations of higher output and stable demand and economy.

US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index rose 0.3 % month-over-month in December 2024 (vs. 0.1 % in November 2024), matching consensus and marking the highest level since April 2024. Year-over-year, PCE inflation was 2.6 % (vs. 2.4 % in November 2024), the highest in seven months. Core PCE inflation was 0.2 % month-over-month in December 2024 (vs. 0.1 % in November 2024), also matching consensus. Year-over-year, core PCE inflation was 2.8 % (vs. 2.8 % in November 2024), still above the Federal Reserve’s 2 % target.

S&P Global also noted that China’s Manufacturing PMI slipped to 50.1 in January 2025 (vs. 50.5 in December 2024), below the consensus of 50.5. The result marked four consecutive months of factory expansion, albeit the slowest pace in that period, as foreign orders shrank for two months due to rising global trade challenges. Employment fell sharply, the steepest decline since February 2024, and selling prices dropped at the fastest rate since July 2023. Sentiment improved with expectations of business development efforts and supportive government policies, though overall business optimism remained below average because of concerns over US import tariffs.

Special Envoy for Climate and Energy, and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Friday (31/1) that the government does not plan to implement early retirement for coal-fired power plants (PLTU) in 2040. He clarified that the president’s statement meant the government will not build new PLTU after 2040.

Hashim also said the government plans to build nuclear power plants with a total capacity of 4.3 GW, without providing further details. Indonesia’s installed electricity capacity is currently over 90 GW, more than half from coal and less than 15 % from new renewable energy.

BPS reported that Indonesia’s Consumer Price Index (CPI) eased to 0.76 % year-over-year in January 2025 (vs. 1.57 % in December 2024), well below the consensus expectation of 1.88 %. Monthly, Indonesia recorded a deflation of 0.76 % (vs. 0.44 % inflation in December 2024), contrary to consensus of 0.32 % inflation. The monthly deflation was driven by electricity tariff subsidies that contributed a 1.47 percentage-point deflation as tariffs were discounted for customers up to 2,200 VA. Core inflation in January 2025 was 2.36 % year-over-year (vs. 2.26 % in December 2024), slightly above the consensus of 2.3 % year-over-year.

BPS also recorded that foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia reached 1.24 million in December 2024 (+13.8 % month-over-month, +8.7 % year-over-year). This result brought total international arrivals in 2024 up 19.1 % year-over-year to about 13.9 million, 99.3 % of the government’s 2024 target of 14 million and the highest level since the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Reports Q4 2024 Production and Sales Figures
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang (ANTM) recorded gold production of 8.8 thousand ounces in Q4 2024, down 10.2% QoQ and 9.0% YoY. Feronickel production was 4,858 tonnes Ni (-4.3% QoQ, -14.6% YoY) and nickel ore production was 2.6 million wet metric tonnes (-15.6% QoQ, -5.1% YoY). For the full year 2024, ANTM produced 32.8 thousand ounces of gold (-15.6% YoY), 20,103 tonnes Ni (-6.4% YoY) and 9.9 million wet metric tonnes of nickel ore (-26.1% YoY). Gold sales in 2024 rose to 1.41 million troy ounces (+67.5% YoY), reaching an all-time high. Feronickel sales in 2024 were 19,452 tonnes Ni (-3.4% YoY) and nickel ore sales were 8.4 million wet metric tonnes (-28.7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: NISP Posts Q4 2024 Net Profit of Rp1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP reported a net profit of 1 trillion rupiah in Q4 2024 (+1% YoY, -27% QoQ), bringing 2024 net profit to 4.9 trillion rupiah (+19% YoY). The performance was driven by Net Interest Income (NII) growing to 2.9 trillion rupiah in Q4 2024 (+16% YoY, +2.5% QoQ), resulting in 2024 NII of 11 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY). Net Interest Margin remained at 4.4% in Q4 2024 and 2024. NISP continued to reverse its provision expense, which fell to 9 billion rupiah in Q4 2024 (vs. a reversal of 261 billion rupiah in Q4 2023), while Gross NPL stayed at 1.6% (vs. 1.6% in Q4 2023, 1.8% in Q3 2024). Non-operational expenses were 268 billion rupiah in Q4 2024 (vs. non-operational income of 8 billion rupiah in Q4 2023, 382 billion rupiah in Q3 2024). Total non-operational income for 2024 was 284 billion rupiah (vs. 16 billion rupiah in 2023).

tickerNews.title: PGAS Targets 200,000 New Household Gas Connections in 2025
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) aims to add 200,000 new household gas network connections in 2025, bringing the total household gas network to over 1 million connections. By the end of 2024, PGAS had connected more than 815,000 households with a pipeline length of 20,000 km. PGAS will allocate capex of 338 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 361 million US dollars in 2024), with 67% dedicated to upstream gas infrastructure and 33% to downstream development.

tickerNews.title: MYOR Plans Rp1 Trillion Capex in 2025
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah announced that it will allocate capex of 1 trillion rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2 trillion rupiah in 2024). The funds will strengthen the packaged foods and packaged beverages segments, expected to drive expansion and increase production capacity. Management is optimistic that Q4 2024 performance will meet targets. The main challenge in 2025 remains commodity price fluctuations, which could affect profit margins. Mayora is also preparing to launch several new products to strengthen its market position, though details remain undisclosed.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Announces Two HPAL Projects with Total Capacity 55,000 Tons Nickel MHP per Year
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) stated that its two HPAL projects will be operational in 2025, with a combined production capacity of 55,000 tons of nickel MHP per year. The first HPAL plant will produce 30,000 tons of nickel MHP annually and is being built by MBMA together with GEM Co. Ltd. through PT ESG New Energy Material, where MBMA holds a 60% stake. MBMA also holds a 12.5% stake in PT Meiming New Energy Material, which operates an HPAL smelter with a capacity of 25,000 tons per year and is currently in commissioning.

tickerNews.title: PYFA Secures Rp120 Billion Credit Facility from BMRI
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma, through its subsidiary PT Ethica Industri Farmasi, signed a credit facility agreement of 120 billion rupiah with Bank Mandiri (BMRI). The facility is intended to refinance existing assets, including land and factory buildings. The loan carries an interest rate of 8.25% per annum with a term of 96 months from the signing date.

tickerNews.title: ENAK Announces Barokah Melayu Food as New Controlling Shareholder
tickerNews.content: Champ Resto Indonesia announced that Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd. became the new controlling shareholder of the company. The change occurred after Barokah Melayu Food completed a voluntary tender offer for approximately 165.5 million (7.64%) ENAK shares at a price of 1,025 rupiah per share on 30 January 2025. After the tender offer, Barokah Melayu Food holds approximately 1.1 billion (50.1%) ENAK shares.

tickerNews.title: GLVA Share Sale of 17 Million Shares at Avg Rp308
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Galva Technologies, PT Elsiscom Prima Karya, sold 17 million GLVA shares at an average price of 308 rupiah per share on 31 January 2025. The total transaction value was 5.23 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Elsiscom Prima Karya's ownership in GLVA decreased from 58.95% to 57.82%.
